extendedIngredients.name: all purpose flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 1/4 cups all purpose flour (separated to 2 cups and 1/4 cup)

extendedIngredients.name: powdered sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup powdered sugar to sprinkle over the top when cooled

extendedIngredients.name: white sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups of white sugar (separated to 1/2 cup, and 1 1/2 cups)

recipes.title: The BEST Lemon Bars

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are great choices for Lemon Bar. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Solera Cream Sherry with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: First preheat your oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, blend together 2 cups of flour, 1/2 cup sugar, and softened butter. Press this into a 9 x 13 pan. Bake for 15  20 minutes or until this is firm and golden.While this is baking, mix together the remaining 1 1/2 cups of sugar, 1/4 cup of flour, and whisk in the lemon juice and 4 eggs.Pour the lemon concoction over the baked bottom and place back into the oven for another 20 minutes.The Lemon Bars will firm up as they cool. After they have completely cooled, sprinkle the powdered sugar over the top, and cut into desired size pieces.Enjoy your yummy new Lemon Bars!Lemon Bar RecipeThese really are the best, and I know this is one of my moms favorite treats. Never a better way to show love than to bake with love, right?Did you like this recipe? steps.step: First preheat your oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, blend together 2 cups of flour, 1/2 cup sugar, and softened butter. Press this into a 9 x 13 pan.
Bake for 15  20 minutes or until this is firm and golden.While this is baking, mix together the remaining 1 1/2 cups of sugar, 1/4 cup of flour, and whisk in the lemon juice and 4 eggs.

Pour the lemon concoction over the baked bottom and place back into the oven for another 20 minutes.The Lemon Bars will firm up as they cool. After they have completely cooled, sprinkle the powdered sugar over the top, and cut into desired size pieces.Enjoy your yummy new Lemon Bars!Lemon Bar Recipe
These really are the best, and I know this is one of my moms favorite treats. Never a better way to show love than to bake with love, right?Did you like this recipe?
